pullRequest.title: Wait for and build split with dynamic filter in Kudu

nodes.bodyText: We can modify QueryRunner createKuduQueryRunnerTpch(TestingKuduServer kuduServer, Optional<String> kuduSchemaEmulationPrefix, Iterable<TpchTable<?>> tables) to re-use this method
We can import SessionBuilder

Probe is pretty technical term. Also, in theory, DF can be a result of something else.
what about
kudu.dynamic-filtering.wait-timeout

?
Why not just intersect this with tableHandle.getConstraint() above ?
Use ImmutableMap.of
I think you can use directExecutor, unless you ran into some issue which led to using thread pool here ?
Can be simplified by removing the conditions above and modifying this to if (blockingTimeoutMillis <= 0 || !dynamicFilter.isAwaitable())
We don't need any of the assertions around dynamicFiltersStats as these are connector agnostic and already getting tested in DynamicFilterService
Please check if adding assertions along the lines of assertDynamicFiltering in TestMemorySmoke works
If I'm understanding this correctly, this will wait for narrowing down of dynamic filter only twice, ideally we want to wait for dynamic filter to complete.

We could rename this to KuduDynamicFilteringSplitSource.
Instead of the future, we could take the delegate split source and dynamic filter as parameters.
You could then implement the waiting logic in the methods here using the dynamic filter and delegate split source.
Let's make it kudu.dynamic-filtering.wait-timeout
do we simplify domains somewhere?
Let's use @MinDuration("0ms") annotation
please validate that provided timeout >= 0

nodes.bodyText: static import MILLISECONDS
nit: each arg in newline
DF could be narrowed down multiple times (you need to create future in getNextBatch). You could also use approach as in io.prestosql.plugin.hive.BackgroundHiveSplitLoader.HiveSplitLoaderTask#process
not really, @MinDuration("0ms") works only for feature config, not session properties set manually.

nodes.bodyText: blockingTimeoutMillis should not be negative
don't use aberrations o
don't use aberrations s, rename to splitSource
This is prone to race condition, future could complete just after future.isDone() is checked

extract new KuduDynamicFilteringSplitSource(table, splitSchedulingStrategy, dynamicFilter, blockingTimeoutMillis); to internal method and don't call top-level getSplitSource (it creases tricky recursive flow)
this case is redundant
This case is redundent. Coercion is already tested in different places

Let's just have a single DF test in this. Other cases are already covered pretty well. However, it would be nice to have a test like: io.prestosql.plugin.hive.TestBackgroundHiveSplitLoader#testIncompleteDynamicFilterTimeout
I think in negative value case Duration.valueOf will throw exception anyway, we won't reach here
I don't think this check can fail

This test should be on top of KuduSplitManager, similar to TestBackgroundHiveSplitLoader#testIncompleteDynamicFilterTimeout.
You shouldn't have to expose completedOrTimeout to test this.
static import NOT_BLOCKED
requireNotNull(future, "future is null")

this still doesn't help with race condition, e.g: other thread might be just after obtaining split source via getSplitSource(table, splitSchedulingStrategy, dynamicFilter) but before exiting .thenApply(result -> getSplitSource(table, splitSchedulingStrategy, dynamicFilter));. In that case cancellation would be successful, but split source is not closed.
remove this test
remove this test
remove this test
remove this test
remove this test
remove this test
remove this test
remove this test
redunrent else
I don't think it can complete exceptionally
we changed that method to return list now: io.prestosql.plugin.memory.TestMemorySmoke#getOperatorRowsRead
we changed that method to accept array of ints now: io.prestosql.plugin.memory.TestMemorySmoke#assertDynamicFiltering
